The category of abelian groups satisfies Grothedieck's Axiom AB5.

type:
{J : Type u} →
  [inst : CategoryTheory.SmallCategory J] →
    [inst_1 : CategoryTheory.IsFiltered J] → CategoryTheory.Limits.PreservesFiniteLimits CategoryTheory.Limits.colim
name: AddCommGroupCat.instPreservesFiniteLimitsFunctorAddCommGroupCatInstAddCommGroupCatLargeCategoryCategoryColimHasColimitsOfShapeOfHasColimitsOfSizeInstHasColimitsOfSizeAddCommGroupCatMaxInstAddCommGroupCatLargeCategory_3
docString: The category of abelian groups satisfies Grothedieck's Axiom AB5.

A key lemma to prove $A_5$ is simple. Shows that any normal subgroup of an alternating group on
at least 5 elements is the entire alternating group if it contains a 3-cycle.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : Fintype α] [inst_1 : DecidableEq α],
  5 ≤ Fintype.card α →
    ∀ {f : Equiv.Perm α} (hf : Equiv.Perm.IsThreeCycle f),
      Subgroup.normalClosure {{ val := f, property := (_ : f ∈ alternatingGroup α) }} = ⊤
name: Equiv.Perm.IsThreeCycle.alternating_normalClosure
docString:
A key lemma to prove $A_5$ is simple. Shows that any normal subgroup of an alternating group on
at least 5 elements is the entire alternating group if it contains a 3-cycle.

The normal closure of the 5-cycle `finRotate 5` within $A_5$ is the whole group. This will be
used to show that the normal closure of any 5-cycle within $A_5$ is the whole group.

type:
Subgroup.normalClosure
    {{ val := finRotate 5, property := (_ : finRotate (bit1 2) ∈ alternatingGroup (Fin (bit1 2))) }} =
  ⊤
name: alternatingGroup.normalClosure_finRotate_five
docString:
The normal closure of the 5-cycle `finRotate 5` within $A_5$ is the whole group. This will be
used to show that the normal closure of any 5-cycle within $A_5$ is the whole group.

A finite group of prime order is simple.

type:
∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Group α] [inst_1 : Fintype α] {p : ℕ} [hp : Fact (Nat.Prime p)],
  Fintype.card α = p → IsSimpleGroup α
name: isSimpleGroup_of_prime_card
docString: A finite group of prime order is simple.

The smallest ideal containing a given element.

type: {P : Type u_1} → [inst : Preorder P] → P → Order.Ideal P
name: Order.Ideal.principal
docString: The smallest ideal containing a given element.

The normal closure of $(04)(13)$ within $A_5$ is the whole group. This will be
used to show that the normal closure of any permutation of cycle type $(2,2)$ is the whole group.

type:
Subgroup.normalClosure
    {{ val := Equiv.swap 0 4 * Equiv.swap 1 3,
        property := (_ : Equiv.swap 0 4 * Equiv.swap 1 3 ∈ alternatingGroup (Fin 5)) }} =
  ⊤
name: alternatingGroup.normalClosure_swap_mul_swap_five
docString:
The normal closure of $(04)(13)$ within $A_5$ is the whole group. This will be
used to show that the normal closure of any permutation of cycle type $(2,2)$ is the whole group.

The minimum number of generators of a group.

type: (G : Type u_3) → [inst : Group G] → [h : Group.FG G] → ℕ
name: Group.rank
docString: The minimum number of generators of a group.

The free condensed abelian group on a finite set.

name: Condensed.finFree
docString: The free condensed abelian group on a finite set.

type:
{C : Type u₁} →
  [inst : CategoryTheory.Category.{u₂, u₁} C] →
    [inst_1 : CategoryTheory.PreGaloisCategory C] →
      {F : CategoryTheory.Functor C FintypeCat} →
        [self : CategoryTheory.PreGaloisCategory.FibreFunctor F] →
          (G : Type u₂) →
            [inst_2 : Group G] →
              [inst_3 : Finite G] → CategoryTheory.Limits.PreservesColimitsOfShape (CategoryTheory.SingleObj G) F
name: CategoryTheory.PreGaloisCategory.FibreFunctor.preservesQuotientsByFiniteGroups

A finite group of prime order is simple.

type:
∀ {α : Type u} [inst : AddGroup α] [inst_1 : Fintype α] {p : ℕ} [hp : Fact (Nat.Prime p)],
  Fintype.card α = p → IsSimpleAddGroup α
name: isSimpleAddGroup_of_prime_card
docString: A finite group of prime order is simple.
